definition: Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
variant of 紮|扎[za1]
penetrating (as of cold)/struggle
variant of 紮|扎[zha1]
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
variant of 剋|克[ke4]
to scold/to beat

sentences.english: The development of Balzac's literary ideology is a complicated course.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔扎克文艺思想的发展是一个错综复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Therefore, Gao Ming-kai cannot be neglected as a disseminator of Balzac's works in China.
sentences.chinese: 他是不容忽略的巴尔扎克传播者。

sentences.english: Honoré de Balzac was a French novelist and playwright.
sentences.chinese: 是巴尔扎克发表的第一部长篇哲理小说。

sentences.english: Don't tell me about these complicated sentences from Balzac's short story.
sentences.chinese: 不要给我讲巴尔扎克短篇小说里的这些复杂的句子。

definition: Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Alexandre Dumas, père (1802-1870), French writer
Stendhal

Guy de Maupassant (1850-1893), French novelist and short story writer
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]

definition: Marcel Proust (1871-1922), French author
Voltaire (1694-1778), Enlightenment philosopher
Victor Hugo (1802-1885), French writer
Ivan Sergeevich Turgenev (1818-1883), Russian novelist
Maugham (family name)/W. Somerset Maugham (1874-1965), English writer
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
Franz Kafka (1883-1924), Czech Jewish writer
Prosper Mérimée (1803-1870), French scholar and writer, author of novel Carmen on which Bizet based his opera
Dickens (name)/Charles Dickens (1812-1870), great English novelist
George Bernard Shaw (1856-1950), Irish dramatist and writer
